item.description:
Please join us for a discussion of Chapter 9 of "The Artist's Way" or Chapter 8 of "Finding Water." Chapter 9 is "Recovering a Sense of Compassion." We'll take up topics from the chapters, including enthusiasm, creative u-turns, resistance, and compassion.

In writing about enthusiasm, Cameron says "In order to work well, many artists find that their work spaces are best dealt with as play spaces... toys from the five and dime, tiny miniature Christmas lights, papier-mâché monsters, hanging crystals, a sprig of flowers..."

Maybe you've already picked up a few fun and/or inspiring items like this on artist's dates or on a walk through one of these beautiful Spring afternoons. If so, bring one or two of your finds along. Maybe it's not even an object, but a mental image your took. Whatever--if it made you smile, it might be fun to share.

Please bring a copy of the book you're following, a pen or pencil, and your sense of the absurd. More information on finding either book is on the message board (under the "discussions" tab). Information about parking and public transportation near Gallery 263 can also be found on the message board.

**Please note that we are still meeting at 7pm **

If you are able, please bring a $5 donation to the Gallery for the use of their space -- thank you!!
